meanings.definition: A roughneck is a person who works on an oil rig.
meanings.sent1: The roughnecks on the oil rig work hard every day.
meanings.sent2: The roughnecks used heavy machinery to extract oil from the ground.
meanings.sent3: The roughnecks joked about their oily overalls after a long day's work.
meanings.sent4: The roughnecks were like modern-day treasure hunters, seeking black gold.
meanings.sent5: The image of roughnecks covered in oil stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Roughnecks can refer to a group of workers who perform manual labor.
meanings.sent1: The construction site was bustling with roughnecks carrying heavy materials.
meanings.sent2: The roughnecks in the warehouse unloaded boxes with precision.
meanings.sent3: The roughnecks playfully challenged each other to a race with wheelbarrows.
meanings.sent4: The roughnecks' muscles bulged as they lifted the heavy crates effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sound of roughnecks hammering away echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: Roughnecks can also refer to a group of rowdy or tough individuals.
meanings.sent1: The roughnecks at the bar were causing a ruckus with their loud laughter.
meanings.sent2: The roughnecks in the alley looked intimidating with their leather jackets.
meanings.sent3: The roughnecks challenged each other to an arm-wrestling match for fun.
meanings.sent4: The roughnecks' tough exterior hid their kind hearts underneath.
meanings.sent5: The image of roughnecks standing defiantly against the wind was unforgettable.
